sub_title: Shaping our future values with Design
summary:
I believe that design is a very powerful tool to bring about change in the habits & beliefs of society. I firmly believe – ‘Design creates culture. Culture shapes values. Values determine the future.’- Robert L. Peters.

For me, Designing simply means ‘Exploration, Experience & Uniqueness’. I am a keen observer, I learn many things by imagining virtual walkthroughs through natural and human-made things, understand their purpose, and get inspired by them. My design objective is quite focused on asking the right logical questions and solving real problems to impact society and nature positively.

Being a mechanical engineer and a designer, I can effectively bridge the gaps between conceptualization and actualization and have a firm grasp of product implementation. I am skilled in research, context mapping (i.e. defining the problem so well that it leads to a solution), conceptualization, prototyping/ fabrication/ manufacturing & analysis. I have an intuitive approach to learning new technologies and can incorporate them into my design practice to bring out the best product experience for the users.

Some of my hobbies are exploring nature and cultures, making films & documentaries, dancing, etc. These days, I am focusing on learning the role of behavioural sciences in design processes, exploring new methodologies for a deeper understanding of design context & developing a more dynamic approach towards managing the design process.

projects.title: Designing a underwater plastic scanning system for Noria
projects.description:
Noria is a start-up that designs solutions for eliminating plastic from waterways in the Netherlands. Our objective was to develop a plastic monitoring system for quantifying the amount of plastic waste flowing through waterways, specifically macro plastics (>5mm). We developed a functioning product using a SONAR sensor with telemetry capabilities that fits the company's sustainable vision and adapts to different terrains. 

My contribution: System modelling and architecture, CAD, Design of an anchoring system, FEA, Product Experience, Cognitive and physical ergonomics, LCA, Designing for manufacturing/assembly, Prototyping and Testing, and Team/Project management.

contributors.headline: Shaping our future values with Design

projects.title: Designing an intervention named 'Connect'
projects.description:
The Municipality of Dordrecht aims to create a sustainable society by 2030. To do that they want to unlock the full potential of people’s contribution to the energy transition. They want to bring more and more people into the transition by spreading awareness about sustainable lifestyles.
I designed an intervention named 'Connect' that aims to deepen the awareness of sustainable living by leveraging people-to-people connections. It is a conversational tool for energy coaches that also provides an engaging and collaborative learning experience to residents in a playful way. 

My contribution: User research, Synthesis, Concept Design, Ideation, Culture studies, Evaluation and user testing, Prototyping, and Project management. 
Tools used: Blender, Keyshot, Unity, Augmented Reality (Adobe)

contributors.headline: Shaping our future values with Design

projects.title: The Indian smart Home | Final Year Project
projects.description:
UI/UX | service design | product design

The Indian Smart Home project was an attempt to bring together current technologies such as the Internet of Things (IoT), Machine Learning (ML), Additive Manufacturing, and Rapid Prototyping to create working models of four smart appliances that would elevate the lifestyle of the Indian common man. Successfully working prototypes of the following appliances were achieved at the end of the project.

TeleCook

This product was designed for the working class, the bachelors, or the old aged. A smart rice cooker with a cellular connection that could be ordered to cook rice automatically from a cell phone application. The quantity and consistency of rice could be controlled as well. The use case could be extended to make other dishes that are prepared by steaming.

Foretele & Holmes

This appliance was aimed to improve safety in the Indian kitchen concerning the LPG cylinders. It senses leakages above the permissible threshold and notifies the user to cut the supply. If the user is unable to do so, the system will cut off the supply by itself. It also senses the current level of LPG in the cylinder, and using machine learning algorithms, predicts the day when it will run out. It can place an order for a new one automatically if enabled.

DrySense

A smart drying rack for clothes aimed to reduce the daily work of Indian homemakers. DrySense detects when the clothes on the rack are completely dry and automatically collects them all into a basket.

Aura

A centralized human presence sensing system that could automatically control the lights in a room using multiple infrared sensors and a suitable logic for processing the sensor information.

profile_positions.title: Graduation Intern

profile_positions.description:
Invented a portable wet waste processing station called WasteRab, with a processing capacity of ~100kg/hour. It was developed specifically for Indian lifestyles and the right scale.

By bringing the wet waste into a handleable form, (by reducing the volume, maintaining the particle size, and controlling the moisture), we were able to cut down the transportation cost by up to 80%.
https://shreyas-kulkarni.webflow.io/wasterab

Led the need-finding research, contextual analysis, prototyping, and testing of WasteRab

Executed a pilot run of 3 months for WasteRab, with a subscription-based service and product-selling business model
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder, Design & Strategy

profile_positions.description:
Performed analytical study about manufacturing feasibility and quality control on reverse engineering and import substitution projects such as coal mill pulverizer, Metaflex plastic pin misalignment coupling & intermediate stage rolling mill coupling. 

Cohosted a training program on ‘right assembly practices’ for assembly line workers by collaborating with SKF training teams.

Built and led the research and development team of 10 people in the company's new venture in waste management.

Designed and presented an optimized centralized waste management plant layout to the Sangli Government as a part of a tender with a 68% cost reduction. 

Developed WasteTrap, a canal cleaning assistive system that is designed to mitigate the damaging unhealthy repercussions of frequent flooding in Kolhapur city for Kolhapur Municipality 
https://shreyas-kulkarni.webflow.io/works/wastetrap

profile_positions.description:
Worked on developing the concept of ‘Gear Hospital’(service design)- Emergency repairs and re-manufacturing services, which is a healthy step towards sustainability

Developed and implemented the ‘outside processing and witnessing’ manufacturing plan by optimizing JIT deliveries. 

Studied and proposed an assembly plan with in-process critical quality checks to increase the quality and speed of production of mid-range gearboxes. 

Optimization of lead time with an extremely simple and affordable solution. Implemented the idea of reducing the movement of jobs by tweaking the layout of machines in the manufacturing and assembly facility (simulated and analyzed using FlexSim) that added 2-3 gearboxes/month to the production rate.
profile_positions.title: Intern | Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Study of design consideration, staging and selection of gearbox for the required application. Learning gearbox calculations and validating those using KISSsoft software for Sugar mill gearbox (SMG).

Study and apply the tolerances and assembly Equipment & practices for SMG

Case study of vendor assessment and management plans & in-house raw material testing (Ultrasonic sound test, D.P./M.P.T/Radiography, chemical composition and macrostructure checks for forging quality)

Testing of Teeth meshing and testing of the gearbox under no load and load conditions for noise, vibrations, Temperature rise & oil leakages.

Case study of smart condition monitoring systems for rolling mill Gear Box used in the steel industry.

volunteer_experiences.role: Technical Trainer | Arduino and computational logic workshop
volunteer_experiences.description: Hands-on Introductory workshop on industrial applications of Arduino and PLC in IoT, how industries are changing, how to use these technologies & what are the capabilities of these technologies for students of PACE-Kolhapur working in electrical and automobile domains.

The flagship event of KITCoEK and Walk With World, Abhigyan is an international student conference wherein a cluster of renowned personalities grace the event with their interactive lectures and experiences. It has become a platform for students all over India to hear and interact with the leading minds of today. Abhigyan has set a benchmark by gathering an audience of 1200+ students and professionals each year for the past 6 years.

For Abhigyan 2019, my responsibility as a Brand Manager was to establish the presence of the event in Maharashtra (mainly western and southern). As the head of a team of 18 people, I worked towards developing an elegant multi-facet brand image of the event by collaborating with the other committees of the event.

The branding strategy we implemented included - analysis of previous years to find the type of audience in focus, establishing a presence on social media, engaging the attendees by bringing transparency about the progress of the event through social media, day by day reveal of posters & promotional videos recorded by the guests/speakers, designing graphical content (starter kits, flyers, posters, posts, stories), venue arrangements for a seamless experience like the stage, screens, food court, registration counters, etc. The graphic design team worked constantly to maintain a constant theme in every aspect of communication to the audience. We also worked out the event day strategies like behavioral code, micro-level event schedule for various teams to make the execution extremely smooth and engaging to offer the audience a comfortable experience.

Because of this strategic execution, the participation count skyrocketed to 1800+ entries with the closing of entries 14 days before the event. This had never happened in Abhigyan's history. Looking at the feedback from the audience, I could confidently say that we succeeded in creating a positive and lasting impact on Abhigyan as well as the people who made it possible.

Dialogue is an annual meet of YesOrNo foundation where over 250 people working at various levels in tech companies (mainly like Crompton-Greaves, Mercedes, Mahindra, Mahindra-Tech, Tata, etc.) come together to discuss, debate and validate the process of achieving personal goals.
My responsibility was to manage the inaugural, valedictory ceremony & 4 guest lectures with the team of 9 members. Designing, printing and distribution of starter kits and certificates.
Trained a class of 90 undergrads about Foley, sound direction (post production), lighting & acting on camera.
